founders.title: Beware of Entrepreneurship
founders.excerpt: Entrepreneurship is like a ghost fight. You are fighting with your own ghost every day. In this heartfelt account Sunny Ghosh talks about the struggles of entrepreneurship beyond the usual chase of unicorn statuses and success stories.
founders.author: Pankaj Mishra

founders.title: The making of Girish Mathrubootham
founders.excerpt: Uncovering the untold story of a quiet visionary, this piece explores the journey of Girish Mathrubootham who played a pivotal role in propelling the country to the forefront of the global software industry.
founders.author: Pankaj Mishra

founders.title: Meet India’sgeekiest couple:Kiran Jonnalagadda and Zainab Bawa
founders.excerpt: Founded by Kiran Jonnalagadda and Zainab Bawa, HasGeek is more than just a tech community. Their story, a blend of technology, activism, and community building has revolutionized the tech ecosystem in India with integrity, innovation, and inclusivity.
founders.author: Shrabonti Bagchi

founders.title: Death of a startup founder
founders.excerpt: Arvindkumar Alagarswamy, a passionate entrepreneur, battling late-stage pancreatic cancer, founded Attune Technologies to revolutionize healthcare software solutions. This story, a tale of resilience, innovation and the human spirit, explores his life, his company and the challenges faced by his family and team in the wake of his loss.
founders.author: Pankaj Mishra

founders.title: Silk, India’s oldest general-interest mailing list, has been its Geek Central for 18 years
founders.excerpt: Silk, India's oldest mailing list, was founded in 1998 by tech-savvy teenagers. Despite the rise of social media, Silk continues to attract passionate individuals seeking in-depth conversations and a sense of community.
founders.author: Shrabonti Bagchi

founders.title: The curious story of Amit Bhardwaj and how he made millionaires and fools of Bitcoin investor
founders.excerpt: Zakhil Suresh, an aspiring chartered accountant in Kodungallur, a small port town on the Malabar coast in Kerala, has a nose for investment opportunities. Suresh, 23, was an early entrant into the swirling world of Bitcoins, a so-called cryptocurrency that is taking the world by storm — it has appreciated about 33 million times since […]
founders.author: Anand Murali

founders.title: Inside the Indian BuzzFeed competitor you’ve never heard of
founders.excerpt: WittyFeed, a viral content platform, grew rapidly by blending creative storytelling with data-driven strategies. Its journey reveals the challenges of sustaining growth in a competitive content landscape and the nuances of creating stories that resonate globally.
founders.author: Jayadevan P K

indians.title: This Yin and Yang of Screens
indians.excerpt: We’ve never been more involved with our screens but is the relationship a healthy one? Even as Indians spent 4.7 hours on average on their phones in 2021, how much is too much?
indians.author: Pavitra Jayaraman

indians.title: Removing Child Sexual Abuse Material from the Internet
indians.excerpt: In 2019, the NCMEC got 16.9 million suspected CSAM reports, of which nearly 1.98 million were from India—the single-largest out of 241 countries. The Indian subcontinent ranks high when it comes to CSAM consumption.
indians.author: Monica Jha

indians.title: Indian Teens Vent, Stan and Socialise on Discord
indians.excerpt: Headquartered in San Francisco and founded in 2015, Discord is a platform that allows users to build and engage with like-minded members through chat, voice and video channels.
indians.author: Shadma Shaikh

indians.title: Chinese app Kwai turns a blind eye to videos of underage girls in India
indians.excerpt: Kwai, a Chinese short-video app, faced challenges in moderating sensitive content involving underage users in India. This story examines how the platform’s policies struggled to keep up, sparking important conversations about digital safety and content regulation in the online space.
indians.author: Shadma Shaikh

indians.title: An open source resistance takes shape as tech giants race to map the world
indians.excerpt: Through the journey of the dedicated contributors in the OpenStreetMap community in India, this story explores the rise of OpenStreetMap community, highlighting its role in disaster relief and urban planning.
indians.author: Shadma Shaikh

indians.title: India’s big data hunt for cures to its mental, ageing related diseases
indians.excerpt: As India’s population rapidly ages, a crisis looms. This story aims at understanding the complexities of India's aging population.
indians.author: Pankaj Mishra

indians.title: Remembering Atul Chitnis, internet pioneer and fierce open source warrior
indians.excerpt: Atul Chitnis, a pioneer of India’s open-source movement, left behind a legacy of collaboration and innovation. His contributions to the tech community reflect his passion for knowledge sharing and his impact on shaping the open-source ecosystem in India.
indians.author: Shivam Srivastav

indians.title: The last picture you’ll ever take
indians.excerpt: The Beas River tragedy of 2014, where 24 engineering students tragically lost their lives while taking selfies, highlights the alarming rise of selfie-related deaths in India. This story talks about the increasing popularity of smartphones and social media, leading to reckless behavior and a disregard for personal safety in pursuit of the perfect shot.
indians.author: Monica Jha

indians.title: Silk, India’s oldest general-interest mailing list, has been its Geek Central for 18 years
indians.excerpt: Silk, India's oldest mailing list, was founded in 1998 by tech-savvy teenagers. Despite the rise of social media, Silk continues to attract passionate individuals seeking in-depth conversations and a sense of community.
indians.author: Shrabonti Bagchi

indians.title: The curious story of Amit Bhardwaj and how he made millionaires and fools of Bitcoin investor
indians.excerpt: Zakhil Suresh, an aspiring chartered accountant in Kodungallur, a small port town on the Malabar coast in Kerala, has a nose for investment opportunities. Suresh, 23, was an early entrant into the swirling world of Bitcoins, a so-called cryptocurrency that is taking the world by storm — it has appreciated about 33 million times since […]
indians.author: Anand Murali

indians.title: This is Seelampur: India’s Digital Underbelly Where Your Phones Go To Die
indians.excerpt: Nearly a quarter of India’s three million tonnes of e-waste generated every year is dumped in Seelampur. If you live in north India, chances are high that the smartphone you bought last year and trashed because something better came along, went to die here.
indians.author: Pankaj Mishra

startups.title: Fellowship
startups.excerpt: Become a FactorDaily Fellow What role do newsrooms play in a world dealing with information overload? A multifold one where it can curate the most relevant information to a hyperlocal audience, to present data points and information in a discerning format and to help its audience make sense of things. Newsrooms are also responsible to […]
startups.author: admin-aghoshx

startups.title: Beware of Entrepreneurship
startups.excerpt: Entrepreneurship is like a ghost fight. You are fighting with your own ghost every day. In this heartfelt account Sunny Ghosh talks about the struggles of entrepreneurship beyond the usual chase of unicorn statuses and success stories.
startups.author: Pankaj Mishra

startups.title: Anand Prakash, India’s bug bounty champ, wants to create a HackerOne rival
startups.excerpt: Anand Prakash, one of India’s leading ethical hackers, built HackerHive to foster a community for ethical hacking after years of identifying vulnerabilities for tech giants. This story explores his journey, the rise of ethical hacking, and how HackerHive is shaping cybersecurity practices.
startups.author: Sriram Sharma

startups.title: Remembering Atul Chitnis, internet pioneer and fierce open source warrior
startups.excerpt: Atul Chitnis, a pioneer of India’s open-source movement, left behind a legacy of collaboration and innovation. His contributions to the tech community reflect his passion for knowledge sharing and his impact on shaping the open-source ecosystem in India.

startups.title: “Hello, Azim Seth!”
startups.excerpt: Azim Seth, once an unskilled worker, carved a remarkable path as an entrepreneur by combining his passion for tea and people. His inspiring journey highlights resilience, self-reinvention, and the unique experiences that shaped his success in hospitality.
startups.author: Pankaj Mishra
